intro: Astragalus khadem-kandicus, commonly known as Persian milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, including parts of Iran and Afghanistan. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow or pale yellow pea-like flowers. Its pods contain small, kidney-shaped seeds that are adapted for dispersal in dry environments. Astragalus khadem-kandicus is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, contributing to soil fertility in harsh conditions.
